intro: Tithymalus parvulus, commonly known as the small tithymalus, is a small flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Tithymalus parvulus is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native habitat.
